title: SharkNinja and iRobot’s Vacuum-Cleaning Robot Dispute Lands in Federal Court
text:
SharkNinja Operating LLC and iRobot Corp. are suing each other over the technology that powers their vacuum-cleaning robots that can map and adapt to a home’s floor plan—and empty their own dust bins.

At stake is a growing market fueled by a proliferation of robot-based consumer products, which drove a roughly 24% revenue increase in 2018 for iRobot, the maker of the Roomba vacuum. Still, iRobot, which sold more than $1 billion in consumer robots in 2018, estimates its products reach only about 11% of U.S. households and even...
description: SharkNinja Operating LLC and iRobot Corp. are suing each other over the technology that powers their vacuum-cleaning robots that can map and adapt to a home’s floor plan—and empty their own dust bins.
